newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani rupee ends down on depreciation.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani rupee ends down on depreciation.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee sagged 0.22 to 41.75 to the dollar at Saturday's close after the central bank adjusted it downward against the dollar. Dealers said the rupee would weaken further next week.

The State (central) Bank of Pakistan set its rate, last changed on May 23, at 40.4600/40.6623 to the dollar, down from 40.3900/40.5920. The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates ended at 3.10 percent from 2.70 on Friday.
"The dollar demand will rise after this depreciation," dealer Owais Kalia said. "The dollar will gain further as there are fears of its creeping devaluation. - Amir Zia 9221-5685192
